boxresin.library.javahttp

Class HttpResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • boxresin.library.javahttp.HttpResponse

  • public class HttpResponse
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing HTTP response. You can get information in response(ex. HTTP status code, body of a message etc) via this class.
    Since:
    v1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      @NotNull java.lang.String getBody()
      Returns content for response message.

      Returns content for response message.
      @NotNull byte[] getBodyAsByteArray()
      Returns content for response message.
      @Nullable java.lang.String getBodyEncoding()
      Returns encoding of content in the response message.
      @Nullable java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String key)
      Returns a header for response message by specified key.

      @NotNull java.lang.String getStatusMessage()

    • Method Detail

      • getStatusCode

        public int getStatusCode()
        Returns:
        HTTP status code as int type (ex. 404)
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getStatusMessage

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.String getStatusMessage()
        Returns:
        A description for HTTP status code as String type (ex. "Not Found")
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getHeader

        @Nullable
public @Nullable java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String key)
        Returns a header for response message by specified key. The key is case-sensitive.
        Returns:
        It will be null if there's no such header
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getHeaders

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getHeaders()
        Returns:
        All headers for response message. NOTE: It's unmodifiable
        Since:
        v1.1.1

      • getBody

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.String getBody()
        Returns content for response message. It can be an HTML document or JSON-formatted text.
        NOTE: It detects content's encoding automatically. If there is no encoding information, default is UTF-8.
        Returns:
        Body for response message as String type
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getBody

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.String getBody(@NotNull
                                                   @NotNull java.lang.String encoding)
                                            throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Returns content for response message. It can be an HTML document or JSON-formatted text.
        Parameters:
        encoding - Name of charset (ex. "UTF-8")
        Returns:
        Body for response message as String type with specified encoding
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getBodyAsByteArray

        @NotNull
public @NotNull byte[] getBodyAsByteArray()
        Returns content for response message. It can be an HTML document or JSON-formatted text.
        Returns:
        Body for response message as byte array
        Since:
        v1.0.0

      • getBodyEncoding

        @Nullable
public @Nullable java.lang.String getBodyEncoding()
        Returns encoding of content in the response message. It will be null if there's no encoding information in the response header.
        NOTE: It always returns as upper case.
        Returns:
        content's encoding
